results.title: Margaret Kernohan: A Commitment to care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Pattern of People”.
Children’s Hearings have been set up in Scotland as informal community tribunals to assess the background and needs of children in trouble. Traces the case of Willie Reid, a neglected boy caught shoplifting. The case is reported to Margaret Kernohan who convenes the hearing at which Willie and his parents are summoned to appear. In earlier days the boy would have been brought before the Juvenile Court and probably punished.

results.title: Margaret Evelyn Walker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Margaret Evelyn Walker is one of the best loved figures in dance in Australia. She discusses her travels in Eastern Europe in the 1940’s and 1950’s, her belief in the power of folk music, her struggles to have it accepted as a subject in schools and of the establishment of the Australian Association for Dance Education. Interview conducted by James Murdoch.

results.title: Margaret Drabble and Mary Gordon
results.brief_description: Two women, novelists and mothers, talk together in a warm, humorous and highly unusual discussion about the ways mothers and children are portrayed both in their own work and by other writers from Jane Austen to Sylvia Plath.
results.description: Two women, novelists and mothers, talk together in a warm, humorous and highly unusual discussion about the ways mothers and children are portrayed both in their own work and by other writers from Jane Austen to Sylvia Plath.

results.title: Margaret Benson: compilation of nine 8mm home movies
results.brief_description: A compilation of nine silent 8mm home movies donated by Margaret Benson comprising images of the Westgate Bridge during construction (1970), Ringwood Technical School, Narooma (1973-74), Barossa Valley wineries, Macleod Technical School (1972).

results.title: Margaret Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
Margaret Barr first trained in the Denishawn style and went on to study with Martha Graham in New York where she developed her interest in choreography. She discusses the importance of stress in the Graham technique and how it differs from classical ballet. Research and interview conducted by James Murdoch.
results.description:

results.title: Margaret Atwood
results.creator_credit: Tracey Fisher, Tier One Communications and TV Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Authors at the harbourfront”.
Margaret Atwood launches her latest work ‘Cat’s eye’ which explores the world of childhood, secrecies, loyalties and betrayals.

results.title: Margaret (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
A mentally handicapped child faces many problems. Margaret’s parents are aware of her difficulties, and of the difficulties in the future when Margaret will be old enough to have to find a job and have boyfriends. One of a series originally created to introduce to the public the range of social services available from government and other agencies.
